messages.message: Hey team, I'm having trouble opening up redesigned refiners on localhost, which is a feature gated behind a flag, I'm assuming `enable_refiner_redesign`, but when I look for where the flag is set in `deployment-config.json` I see it set to `true` for `local` in apps-server. Any tips on making sure feature flags are correctly configured for localhost?
`enable_refiner_redesign` is a hot config variable, so you need to set the value of it differently (using `deployment-config.json` or `env-local.json` won’t work)
how are you running `apps-server? locally or in docker?

for future reference, you can also refer to “Updating configs in local environments” in https://docs.google.com/document/d/14U9YpnnNxS02hvU8l9Iukfo-HkryBTHVrOQyq5opa20/edit

ok so here’s what you need to do
1. exec into the running `apps-server` container by running `docker exec -it instabase-apps-server sh`
2. inside the `apps-server` container, run this command `echo "ENABLE_REFINER_REDESIGN: true" > /config/base-hot-config.yml>`
3. after you run this command, you can check the `apps-server` logs and you should see something about updated hot configs
4. refresh the UI -> you should see the new Refiner
you should not need to recompile or restart `apps-server` at all
